page.title: 18AREAS OF SCIENTIFIC INTEREST
page.content: {Areas of S.S.I=Special Scientific {Interest. }a)Potton Wood. This is a remnant of a primaevil deciduous woodland with plants descended directly from their original ancestors developed soon after the last Ice Age. Unusual plants occur here. Of particular interest is Primula Elatior as this it's the most westerly site in Britain. b)Cockayne Hatley Wood. A second remnant locally of an ancient woodland. This is used by Cambridge University. c)The Old Railway Line. The mile stretch, east of Gamlingay, once a race-horse gallop, produces many unusual weeds plants and insects since, having never been farmland,it has never been sprayed with any form of herbicide or pesticide.
